title: Ticket #7091: Shadow EXCEPTs too readily
description:
The shadow calls EXCEPT() or ASSERT() in a lot of common error conditions that aren't programmer errors and frequently are not fatal. When ABORT_ON_EXCEPTION is set to True, this can lead to a lot of unnecessary core files. The shadow should be made more resilient to common failures. When such failures are non-recoverable, the shadow should have a less drastic way to notify the schedd.

Here are some failures we've observed recently in CHTC:

  • Starter failed to contact the transfer queue manager (i.e. schedd).
  • Starter began output transfer while input transfer was active (main cause fixed in #6728)
  • RPC connection closed when sending a reply. Starter timed out because shadow was blocked connecting to schedd.
